name: Bench Press
description: Heavy compound exercise that targets the chest (pectorals, front deltoids, and triceps). Great exercise for building size and strength.
directions: Lay on a flat bench with a slight arch in your back.
Grab the barbell so that your pinky fingers are touching or near the rings of the barbell.
Drive your feet in to the ground, pushing your upper back in to the bench.
Unrack the barbell over your chest.
Lower the barbell to your chest, so that it touches just above your sternum on your lower pecs.
Pause briefly.
Press the barbell up and slightly back over your face to lockout.
cues: Take a breath at the top of the movement and brace during the concentric.
Keep your glutes on the bench.
Don't bounce the bar on your chest.

name: Incline Bench Press
description: Moderately heavy compound exercise that targets the upper pectorals, front deltoids, and triceps. Great exercise for building size and strength in the chest.
directions: Lay on an incline bench with a slight arch in your back.
Grab the barbell so that your pinky fingers are touching or near the rings of the barbell.
Drive your feet in to the ground, pushing your upper back in to the bench.
Unrack the barbell over your chest.
Lower the barbell to your chest or just short of your upper chest, just below the clavicle.
Pause briefly.
Press the barbell up and slightly back over your face to lockout.
cues: Take a breath at the top of the movement and brace during the concentric.
Don't bounce the bar on your chest.

name: Decline Bench Press
description: Heavy compound exercise that targets the lower pectorals, front deltoids, and triceps. Very good for building size in the chest.
directions: Lay on a decline bench with a slight arch in your back.
Grab the barbell so that your pinky fingers are touching or near the rings of the barbell.
Unrack the barbell over your chest.
Lower the barbell to your chest, so that it touches your sternum or near it.
Pause briefly.
Press the barbell up to lockout.
cues: Take a breath at the top of the movement and brace during the concentric.
Don't bounce the bar on your chest.

name: Low-to-High Cable Crossover
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the lower pectorals. Good for building size in the chest.
directions: Set up a cable machine with both of its arms at a low angle and handles attached.
Grab each handle and step away from the machine so that there is tension in the cables when your arms are stretched out behind your body.
Squeeze the cables together in front of your chest
Slowly let the cables pull back to their starting position.
Pause briefly.
Repeat
cues: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Squeeze your chest, not your biceps.

name: High-to-Low Cable Crossover
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the upper pectorals. Good for building size in the chest.
directions: Set up a cable machine with both of its arms at a high angle and handles attached.
Grab each handle and step away from the machine so that there is tension in the cables when your arms are stretched out behind your body.
Squeeze the cables together in front of your chest
Slowly let the cables pull back to their starting position.
Pause briefly.
Repeat
cues: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Squeeze your chest, not your biceps.

name: Cable Crossover
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the pectorals. Good for building size in the chest.
directions: Set up a cable machine with both of its arms at a flat angle and handles attached.
Grab each handle and step away from the machine so that there is tension in the cables when your arms are stretched out behind your body.
Squeeze the cables together in front of your chest
Slowly let the cables pull back to their starting position.
Pause briefly.
Repeat
cues: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Squeeze your chest, not your biceps.

name: Dumbbell Chest Fly
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the chest muscles by moving the arms in a wide arc. Great for developing chest width and mind-muscle connection.
directions: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand
Start with arms extended above chest, slight bend in elbows
Lower the weights out to sides in a wide arc
Keep the same slight bend in elbows throughout movement
When you feel a stretch in your chest, reverse the motion
Bring the weights back up in an arc motion until they meet above your chest
cues: Maintain slight bend in elbows throughout
Focus on using chest muscles, not arms
Control the weight throughout the movement
Don't let weights go below shoulder level

name: Incline Dumbbell Chest Fly
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the upper chest muscles. Excellent for developing upper chest definition and improving mind-muscle connection.
directions: Lie on an incline bench (15-30 degrees) with a dumbbell in each hand
Start with arms extended above chest, slight bend in elbows
Lower the weights out to sides in a wide arc
Keep the same slight bend in elbows throughout movement
When you feel a stretch in your chest, reverse the motion
Bring the weights back up in an arc motion until they meet above your chest
cues: Maintain slight bend in elbows throughout
Focus on using upper chest muscles
Control the weight throughout the movement
Don't let weights go below shoulder level

name: Decline Dumbbell Chest Fly
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the lower chest muscles. Great for developing lower chest definition and improving mind-muscle connection.
directions: Lie on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand
Start with arms extended above chest, slight bend in elbows
Lower the weights out to sides in a wide arc
Keep the same slight bend in elbows throughout movement
When you feel a stretch in your chest, reverse the motion
Bring the weights back up in an arc motion until they meet above your chest
cues: Maintain slight bend in elbows throughout
Focus on using lower chest muscles
Control the weight throughout the movement
Don't let weights go below shoulder level

name: Pec Deck
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the pectorals. Good for building size in the chest.
directions: Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level.
Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad.
Grab the handles with your elbows slightly bent.
Push the handles together in front of your chest.
Pause briefly at the peak contraction.
Slowly return to the starting position.
cues: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Focus on squeezing your chest muscles.
Control the weight throughout the movement.
Keep your back flat against the pad.

name: Underhand Bench Press
description: Moderately heavy compound exercise that targets the upper pectorals, front deltoids, and triceps with an emphasis on tricep engagement. Great for building strength and size in both chest and triceps.
directions: Lie on a flat bench with feet planted firmly on the ground
Grip the barbell with an underhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder width
Unrack the bar and hold it directly above your chest
Lower the bar with control to the lower chest/upper abs area
Press the bar back up to the starting position
Keep your elbows tucked close to your body throughout the movement
cues: Keep your elbows tucked close to your body
Maintain a slight arch in your back
Drive your feet into the ground
Control the bar path - it should be slightly diagonal
Keep your wrists straight throughout the movement

name: Wide Grip Bench Press
description: Heavy compound exercise that targets the outer chest, front deltoids, and triceps. Excellent for developing chest width and overall upper body strength.
directions: Lie on a flat bench with feet planted firmly on the ground
Grip the barbell with a wide grip, about 1.5-2x shoulder width
Unrack the bar and hold it directly above your chest
Lower the bar with control to mid-chest level
Press the bar back up to the starting position
Keep your elbows at about a 75-degree angle throughout
cues: Keep your shoulder blades pinched together
Maintain a slight arch in your back
Drive your feet into the ground
Focus on pushing with your chest, not your shoulders
Control the descent of the bar

name: Chest Press
description: Moderately heavy compound exercise that targets the pectorals with machine assistance. Great for beginners and for maintaining constant tension throughout the movement.
directions: Adjust the seat height so the handles are at chest level
Sit with your back flat against the pad
Grasp the handles with a full grip
Press the weight forward until your arms are extended
Slowly return to the starting position with control
Keep your elbows at shoulder level throughout
cues: Keep your chest up and out
Maintain contact between your back and the pad
Don't lock out your elbows at the top
Focus on squeezing your chest muscles
Control the weight throughout the movement

name: Push Up
description: Fundamental bodyweight exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. Excellent for building strength and muscle endurance in the upper body.
directions: Start in a plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulders
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground
Push yourself back up to the starting position
Keep your core tight throughout the movement
cues: Keep your body in a straight line - no sagging hips
Keep your elbows at about 45 degrees to your body
Look at a spot on the ground about a foot in front of you

name: Incline Push Up
description: Modified bodyweight exercise that targets the lower chest, front deltoids, and triceps. Great for beginners or for emphasizing the lower chest region.
directions: Place your hands on an elevated surface (bench, step, etc.)
Position your body in a straight line with feet on the ground
Lower your chest toward the elevated surface
Push back up to the starting position
Keep your core engaged throughout
cues: Maintain a straight line from head to heels
Control the movement both up and down
Keep your elbows at about 45 degrees to your body

name: Decline Push Up
description: Advanced bodyweight exercise that targets the upper chest, front deltoids, and triceps. Excellent for developing upper chest strength and definition.
directions: Place your feet on an elevated surface (bench, step, etc.)
Position your hands on the ground slightly wider than shoulders
Lower your chest toward the ground
Push back up to the starting position
Maintain a straight body position throughout
cues: Keep your core tight and body straight
Keep your elbows at about 45 degrees to your body
Look at the ground about a foot in front of your hands

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: Moderately heavy compound exercise that targets the front and side deltoids and triceps. Great for building balanced shoulder development and overhead pressing strength.
directions: Sit on a bench with back support or stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold dumbbells at shoulder level with palms facing forward
Press the dumbbells overhead until arms are fully extended
Lower the weights back to shoulder level with control
Keep your core tight throughout the movement
cues: Press the weights straight up, not forward
Breathe out on the press up
Keep your shoulders down away from your ears

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the side deltoids. Essential for building shoulder width and achieving that capped deltoid look.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells at your sides
Keep a slight bend in your elbows
Raise the dumbbells out to the sides until arms are parallel to the ground
Pause briefly at the top
Lower the weights back down with control
cues: Lead with your elbows, not your hands
Keep the same slight bend in your elbows throughout
Keep your shoulders down and back
Think about pouring water from a pitcher at the top

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the front deltoids. Excellent for developing shoulder strength and anterior deltoid definition.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells in front of thighs
Keep a slight bend in your elbows
Raise the dumbbells forward until arms are parallel to the ground
Pause briefly at the top
Lower the weights back down with control
cues: Keep your shoulders down and back

name: Military Press
description: Heavy compound exercise that targets the entire shoulder complex. One of the best exercises for building overall shoulder strength and mass.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold the barbell at shoulder level with palms facing forward
Press the bar overhead until arms are fully extended
Lower the bar back to shoulder level with control
Keep your core tight and maintain a neutral spine
cues: Push your head through at the top
Keep the bar close to your face on the way up
Lock out your elbows at the top

name: Barbell Upright Row
description: Moderately heavy compound exercise that targets the side deltoids and upper traps. Effective for building shoulder width and trap development.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding barbell in front of thighs
Pull the bar straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows
Keep the bar close to your body throughout the movement
Lower the bar back down with control
Maintain an upright torso throughout
cues: Keep the bar close to your body
Keep your shoulders down until the pull

name: Reverse Pec Deck
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the rear deltoids. Crucial for balanced shoulder development and improved posture.
directions: Sit facing the machine with your chest against the pad
Grab the handles with palms facing down
Pull the handles back and out until arms are parallel to ground
Squeeze your rear deltoids at peak contraction
Return to starting position with control
cues: Keep your chest pressed against the pad
Focus on squeezing your rear deltoids

name: Face Pull
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the rear deltoids and upper back. Essential for shoulder health and posture.
directions: Set cable pulley to upper chest height
Grab rope attachment with both hands, palms facing each other
Step back to create tension in the cable
Pull the rope towards your face, splitting the ends apart at the end
Control the return to starting position
cues: Pull towards your nose, not your chest
Keep your upper arms parallel to ground at end position

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the rear deltoids. Great for building balanced shoulders and improving posture.
directions: Bend over at hips until torso is nearly parallel to ground
Let arms hang straight down, palms facing each other
Raise dumbbells out to sides until upper arms are parallel to ground
Squeeze rear deltoids at top of movement
Lower weights back down with control

name: Machine Shoulder Press
description: Moderately heavy compound exercise that targets the front deltoids and triceps. Great for controlled shoulder development with reduced stabilization requirements.
directions: Adjust seat height so handles are at shoulder level
Grasp handles with a comfortable grip
Press the weight up until arms are extended
Lower the weight back to starting position with control
Keep your back against the pad throughout
cues: Keep your shoulders down and back

name: Cable Kickback
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the triceps. Excellent for developing tricep definition and maintaining constant tension throughout the movement.
directions: Stand sideways to cable machine, upper arm parallel to ground
Grab handle with working arm, keep upper arm still
Extend arm straight back, focusing on tricep contraction
Slowly return to starting position
Keep upper arm stationary throughout movement
cues: Squeeze your tricep at full extension

name: Dumbbell Kickback
description: Light isolation exercise that targets the triceps. Excellent for developing tricep definition and peak contraction.
directions: Bend over at the hips, keeping back straight
Hold a dumbbell in one hand, upper arm parallel to ground
Keep your upper arm still against your side
Extend your arm back until it's straight
Slowly return to the starting position
Complete all reps on one side before switching
cues: Keep your upper arm pinned to your side
Focus on squeezing your tricep at full extension
Keep your core tight and back straight

name: Barbell Overhead Extension
description: Moderately heavy isolation exercise that targets all three heads of the triceps. Great for building overall tricep size and strength.
directions: Sit or stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold barbell overhead with narrow grip
Lower the bar behind your head by bending elbows
Keep upper arms stationary and close to your head
Extend arms back up to starting position
Control the weight throughout the movement
cues: Keep your elbows pointed forward, not out
Don't let your elbows flare out

name: Dumbbell Skullcrusher
description: Moderately heavy isolation exercise that targets the long head of the triceps. Excellent for building tricep mass and strength.
directions: Lie on a bench holding dumbbells above your chest
Keep your upper arms perpendicular to the ground
Lower the dumbbells toward your forehead by bending elbows
Keep upper arms stationary throughout
Extend arms back to starting position
Control the weights throughout
cues: Keep your elbows pointed toward the ceiling
Don't let your elbows flare out

name: Cable Overhead Extension
description: Moderately heavy isolation exercise that targets the long head of the triceps. Great for maintaining constant tension throughout the movement.
directions: Face away from cable machine, feet staggered
Hold rope attachment overhead with both hands
Keep upper arms by your ears, elbows pointed forward
Extend arms forward and down until straight
Slowly return to starting position
Maintain control throughout
cues: Keep your upper arms still by your ears
Don't let your elbows flare out

name: Cable Rope Pulldown
description: Moderately heavy isolation exercise that targets all heads of the triceps. Excellent for developing tricep definition and peak contraction.
directions: Stand facing cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart
Grab rope attachment with palms facing each other
Keep upper arms pinned to your sides
Push the rope down until arms are fully extended
Split the rope apart at the bottom for extra contraction
Slowly return to starting position
cues: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom
Control the weight up and down
Don't let your elbows move forward
Split the rope at the bottom

name: Cable Pushdown
description: Moderately heavy isolation exercise that targets all heads of the triceps. Great for building tricep strength and definition.
directions: Stand facing cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart
Grab straight bar with overhand grip
Keep upper arms pinned to your sides
Push the bar down until arms are fully extended
Squeeze triceps at the bottom
Slowly return to starting position
cues: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Don't let the bar pull your elbows forward
Control the weight up and down

name: Close Grip Bench Press
description: Heavy compound exercise that primarily targets the triceps while also working chest and shoulders. Excellent for building overall tricep strength and mass.
directions: Lie on bench with feet flat on floor
Grip barbell with hands about shoulder-width apart
Lower bar to lower chest with elbows tucked
Press bar back up to starting position
Keep elbows close to body throughout
Maintain control of the bar
cues: Keep your elbows tucked close to your body
Keep your back flat on the bench

name: Close Grip Push Up
description: Bodyweight exercise that emphasizes the triceps while also working chest and shoulders. Great for building tricep strength and endurance.
directions: Start in push-up position with hands close together
Keep your hands directly under your shoulders
Lower your body until chest nearly touches ground
Keep elbows tucked close to body
Push back up to starting position
Maintain straight body alignment
cues: Keep your elbows tucked in tight

name: Chin Up
description: Challenging compound exercise that targets the biceps and lats. Excellent for building pulling strength and upper body mass.
directions: Hang from pull-up bar with underhand grip
Grip slightly narrower than shoulder width
Pull yourself up until chin clears the bar
Focus on driving elbows down and back
Lower yourself with control
Maintain tension throughout
cues: Initiate the pull with your biceps

name: Barbell Curl
description: Classic compound exercise that targets the biceps. One of the best exercises for building overall bicep mass and strength.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold barbell with underhand grip at shoulder width
Keep upper arms stationary against sides
Curl the weight up toward your shoulders
Pause briefly at the top
Lower the weight with control
cues: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Squeeze your biceps at the top
Keep your core tight and back straight

name: Dumbbell Curl
description: Fundamental bicep exercise that allows for natural wrist rotation. Great for building bicep size and strength while working each arm independently.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells at sides
Keep upper arms stationary against your sides
Curl both dumbbells up toward your shoulders
Rotate your wrists slightly as you curl up
Pause at the top
Lower with control to starting position
cues: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Squeeze your biceps at the top

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
description: Variation of the dumbbell curl that targets both the biceps and forearms. Excellent for developing forearm strength and overall arm thickness.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells at sides
Hold dumbbells with neutral grip (palms facing each other)
Keep upper arms stationary against sides
Curl weights up toward shoulders, maintaining neutral grip
Pause briefly at the top
Lower with control to starting position
cues: Keep palms facing each other throughout
Focus on squeezing at the top

name: Cable Hammer Curl
description: Cable variation of the hammer curl providing constant tension throughout the movement. Great for building bicep and forearm strength.
directions: Stand facing cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart
Attach rope handle to low pulley
Grab rope ends with neutral grip (palms facing each other)
Keep elbows at sides and curl rope up toward shoulders
Squeeze biceps at the top
Lower with control to starting position
cues: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Control the weight both up and down
Don't let the weight pull your elbows forward

name: Dumbbell Decline Curl
description: Isolation exercise that places the biceps in a stretched position. Great for developing the long head of the biceps.
directions: Lie on a decline bench with head lower than hips
Hold dumbbells with arms hanging straight down
Keep upper arms perpendicular to the ground
Curl weights up toward shoulders
Pause briefly at peak contraction
Lower weights with control
cues: Keep upper arms still and perpendicular
Focus on full range of motion

name: Bayesian Cable Curl
description: Unique cable curl variation that maintains maximum tension on the biceps throughout the movement. Excellent for developing peak contraction.
directions: Stand sideways to cable machine
Grab handle with outside hand, palm up
Keep elbow elevated and in front of body
Curl handle up and in toward opposite shoulder
Squeeze bicep hard at the top
Lower with control to starting position

name: Cable Curl
description: Cable variation of the bicep curl providing constant tension throughout the movement. Great for building bicep strength and endurance.
directions: Stand facing cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart
Attach straight bar to low pulley
Grab bar with underhand grip at shoulder width
Keep elbows at sides and curl bar up
Squeeze biceps at the top
Lower with control to starting position
cues: Don't let the weight pull you forward
Focus on squeezing at the top

name: Dumbbell Static Curl
description: Isolation exercise that builds bicep strength through isometric holds. Great for developing mind-muscle connection and endurance.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold one dumbbell at 90-degree angle
Hold other dumbbell at full extension
Hold position for prescribed time
Switch arm positions
Alternate between arms

name: Barbell Cheat Curl
description: Heavy variation of the barbell curl using controlled momentum. Good for overloading the biceps with heavier weights than strict curls.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold barbell with underhand grip at shoulder width
Use slight hip drive to initiate curl
Control the weight through the movement
Lower weight slowly and with control
Reset position before next rep
cues: Focus on bicep engagement despite momentum

name: Overhand Bent Row
description: Compound exercise targeting the upper back with emphasis on the rear deltoids and traps. Great for building back width and thickness.
directions: Bend at hips until torso is nearly parallel to ground
Hold barbell with overhand grip, wider than shoulder width
Let bar hang at arms length
Pull bar to lower chest/upper abs
Squeeze shoulder blades together at top
Lower bar with control

name: Underhand Bent Row
description: Heavy compound exercise that targets the lats and general back musculature. Great for building size and strength in the back while emphasizing bicep engagement.
directions: Bend at hips until torso is nearly parallel to ground
Hold barbell with underhand grip at shoulder width
Let bar hang at arms length
Pull bar to lower chest/upper abs
Squeeze back muscles at the top
Lower bar with control
cues: Keep the bar close to your body

name: Pendlay Row
description: Heavy compound exercise that targets the lats and upper back. Excellent for building explosive pulling strength and back thickness.
directions: Start with bar on ground, feet shoulder-width apart
Bend at hips until torso is parallel to ground
Grip bar with overhand grip, wider than shoulder width
Pull bar explosively to lower chest
Lower bar completely to ground between reps
Reset position for each rep
cues: Keep your back parallel to ground
Let the bar touch the ground each rep

name: Pull Up
description: Challenging compound exercise that targets the lats and upper back. One of the best exercises for building back width and overall pulling strength.
directions: Hang from pull-up bar with overhand grip
Grip slightly wider than shoulder width
Pull yourself up until chin clears the bar
Focus on driving elbows down and back
Lower yourself with control
Maintain tension at bottom

name: Lat Pulldown
description: Compound exercise that mimics the pull-up movement pattern. Great for building back width and strength with adjustable resistance.
directions: Sit at machine with thighs secured under pad
Grab bar with overhand grip, wider than shoulders
Start with arms fully extended
Pull bar down to upper chest
Squeeze lats at bottom of movement
Return to start position with control

name: Cable Row
description: Compound exercise that targets the middle back. Excellent for building back thickness and improving posture.
directions: Sit at cable row machine, feet on platform
Grab handle with neutral grip
Keep chest up and back straight
Pull handle to lower chest/upper abs
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return to start position with control

name: T-Bar Row
description: Compound exercise targeting the middle back. Great for building back thickness and strength with a natural movement pattern.
directions: Straddle the bar with chest supported on pad
Grab handles with neutral grip
Start with arms fully extended
Pull weight up by driving elbows back
Squeeze back muscles at top
Lower weight with control

name: Landmine Row
description: Compound exercise that targets the lats and mid back. Good for building unilateral strength and muscle mass.
directions: Stand straddling landmine base
Grab end of bar with one hand
Hinge at hips until torso is nearly parallel to ground
Pull bar end to hip
Lower with control
Complete all reps before switching sides

name: Barbell Deadlift
description: Fundamental compound exercise that targets the entire posterior chain. One of the best exercises for building overall strength and muscle mass.
directions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, bar over mid-foot
Bend down and grip bar just outside legs
Keep chest up, flatten back
Drive through heels to lift bar
Keep bar close to legs throughout
Return bar to ground with control

name: Barbell Stiff-Legged Deadlift
description: Compound exercise targeting the hamstrings and lower back. Excellent for developing hamstring flexibility and strength.
directions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding bar
Keep legs straight but not locked
Hinge at hips, pushing butt back
Lower bar along legs while maintaining back position
Feel stretch in hamstrings
Return to starting position

name: Dumbbell Stiff-Legged Deadlift
description: Compound exercise targeting the hamstrings and lower back. Great variation for focusing on unilateral development and balance.
directions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, dumbbells in front of thighs
Keep legs straight but not locked
Hinge at hips, pushing butt back
Lower weights along legs
Feel stretch in hamstrings
Return to starting position

name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift
description: Compound exercise emphasizing the hip hinge movement. Excellent for developing posterior chain strength and muscle mass.
directions: Start holding bar at hip level
Keep soft bend in knees throughout
Push hips back while lowering bar
Lower bar to mid-shin or until you feel hamstring stretch
Drive hips forward to return to start
Maintain neutral spine throughout

name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
description: Compound exercise targeting the posterior chain. Great for developing hip hinge pattern and hamstring flexibility.
directions: Stand with dumbbells in front of thighs
Keep soft bend in knees throughout
Push hips back while lowering weights
Lower to mid-shin or until you feel hamstring stretch
Drive hips forward to return to start
Maintain neutral spine throughout

name: Lying Leg Curl
description: Isolation exercise targeting the hamstrings. Excellent for developing hamstring strength and muscle definition.
directions: Lie face down on machine, legs straight
Hook ankles under pad
Curl weight up by bending knees
Squeeze hamstrings at top
Lower weight with control
Keep hips pressed into pad throughout

name: Seated Leg Curl
description: Isolation exercise targeting the hamstrings. Great for developing hamstring strength in a seated position.
directions: Sit on machine with back against pad
Hook ankles behind roller pad
Curl weight up by bending knees
Squeeze hamstrings at peak contraction
Lower weight with control
Maintain good posture throughout

name: Low Bar Squat
description: Heavy compound exercise emphasizing posterior chain engagement. Excellent for building overall lower body strength and muscle mass.
directions: Position bar low on rear deltoids
Grip bar with hands as close as mobility allows
Break at hips first, then knees
Sit back and down between your legs
Keep chest up and core braced
Drive through heels to stand

name: High Bar Squat
description: Heavy compound exercise targeting the quads and glutes. Great for building overall leg strength and muscle mass.
directions: Position bar on upper traps
Grip bar with hands just outside shoulders
Break at knees and hips simultaneously
Keep torso more upright than low bar
Descend until thighs are parallel or below
Drive through mid-foot to stand

name: Front Squat
description: Compound exercise emphasizing quad development and core strength. Excellent for building leg strength while maintaining an upright posture.
directions: Rest bar on front deltoids and collarbone
Elbows high, upper arms parallel to floor
Break at knees and hips simultaneously
Keep torso upright throughout movement
Descend until thighs are parallel or below
Drive through mid-foot to stand

name: Hack Squat
description: Machine compound exercise targeting the quads. Great for building leg size and strength with reduced lower back stress.
directions: Position shoulders and back against pads
Feet shoulder width on platform
Unlock machine and control descent
Lower until thighs are parallel or below
Drive through feet to return to start
Keep back pressed against pad
cues: Keep knees in line with toes

name: Pendulum Squat
description: Machine compound exercise targeting the quads with unique pendulum motion. Excellent for building leg size and strength with reduced spinal compression.
directions: Position yourself on the machine with shoulders under pads
Place feet shoulder-width apart on platform
Unlock the mechanism and control the descent
Lower until thighs are parallel or below
Drive through feet to return to start
Keep back against pad throughout

name: Leg Extension
description: Isolation exercise targeting the quadriceps. Excellent for building definition and peak contraction in the quads.
directions: Sit on machine with back against pad
Hook feet under ankle pad
Extend legs until completely straight
Squeeze quads at top of movement
Lower weight with control
Keep back against pad throughout

name: Hip Adductor Machine
description: Isolation exercise targeting the inner thigh muscles. Important for lower body stability and aesthetic development.
directions: Sit on machine with back against pad
Place legs on pads with knees bent
Start with legs spread apart
Squeeze legs together
Control the return to starting position
Maintain good posture throughout

name: Hip Abduction Machine
description: Isolation exercise targeting the outer hip and glute muscles. Essential for hip stability and glute development.
directions: Sit on machine with back against pad
Place legs on pads with knees bent
Start with legs together
Push legs apart against resistance
Control the return to starting position
Keep core engaged throughout

name: Leg Press
description: Heavy compound exercise targeting the entire lower body. Great for building overall leg strength and size with reduced spinal loading.
directions: Sit in machine with back against pad
Place feet shoulder-width apart on platform
Lower weight by bending knees toward chest
Press weight back up without locking knees
Control the descent on next rep
Keep back pressed against pad

name: Barbell Lunge
description: Heavy compound exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Excellent for building unilateral strength and balance.
directions: Hold barbell across upper back
Step forward with one leg into lunge position
Lower until both knees are bent at 90 degrees
Push through front foot to return to start
Alternate legs with each rep
Maintain upright posture throughout

name: Jefferson Deadlift
description: Unique compound exercise targeting the legs asymmetrically. Great for developing hip mobility and overall leg strength.
directions: Stand with barbell between legs at diagonal
Bend down and grab bar with mixed grip
Keep chest up and back straight
Drive through both legs to stand
Return bar to ground with control
Alternate stance between sets

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Compound exercise targeting the chest, front deltoids, and triceps. Great for building balanced strength and muscle mass.
directions: Lie on flat bench with dumbbells at chest level
Press dumbbells straight up until arms are extended
Lower weights with control to sides of chest
Keep slight bend in elbows at bottom
Press back up to starting position
Maintain stable shoulder position

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Compound exercise targeting the upper chest, front deltoids, and triceps. Excellent for developing upper chest fullness.
directions: Lie on incline bench set to 30-45 degrees
Hold dumbbells at chest level
Press weights up and slightly back
Lower dumbbells with control to chest
Keep elbows at 45-degree angle
Press back up to starting position

name: Machine Row
description: Compound exercise targeting the back muscles. Great for building back thickness with reduced stabilization requirements.
directions: Sit at machine with chest against pad
Grab handles with palms facing in
Pull handles toward lower chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return to start position with control
Maintain good posture throughout

name: Dumbbell Pullover
description: Compound exercise targeting the lats and chest. Excellent for developing upper body width and serratus anterior.
directions: Lie across bench with upper back supported
Hold dumbbell overhead with straight arms
Lower weight behind head in arc motion
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Return to starting position
Maintain control of the weight

name: Cable Pullover
description: Isolation exercise targeting the lats. Great for developing mind-muscle connection and maintaining constant tension.
directions: Stand facing away from high cable
Grab cable attachment with both hands
Keep slight bend in elbows
Pull cable down and forward in arc
Feel stretch in lats at top
Control return to start position

name: Seated Calf Raise
description: Isolation exercise targeting the soleus muscle. Essential for complete lower leg development.
directions: Sit on machine with knees bent at 90 degrees
Place balls of feet on platform
Lower heels as far as possible
Push through balls of feet to raise heels
Hold contraction at top
Lower with control

name: Standing Bodyweight Calf Raise
description: Basic isolation exercise targeting the gastrocnemius. Great for building endurance and mind-muscle connection.
directions: Stand on edge of step or platform
Let heels hang off edge
Lower heels below platform level
Push through balls of feet to raise up
Hold contraction at top
Lower with control

name: Standing Machine Calf Raise
description: Isolation exercise targeting the gastrocnemius. Excellent for building calf strength and size.
directions: Position shoulders under pads
Stand on platform with balls of feet
Lower heels toward ground
Push through balls of feet to raise up
Hold peak contraction
Lower with control

name: Leg Press Calf Raise
description: Isolation exercise targeting the calves using the leg press machine. Great for overloading the calves safely.
directions: Sit in leg press with feet on lower platform
Place only balls of feet on edge
Lower heels as far as possible
Push through balls of feet
Hold contraction at top
Lower with control

name: Donkey Calf Raise
description: Isolation exercise targeting the gastrocnemius. Excellent for developing peak contraction in the calves.
directions: Bend over and rest upper body on platform
Place balls of feet on raised surface
Lower heels toward ground
Push through balls of feet
Hold peak contraction
Lower with control

name: Single Arm Cable Overhead Extension
description: Isolation exercise targeting the triceps. Great for developing individual arm strength and muscle definition.
directions: Stand facing away from high cable
Grab handle with one hand overhead
Keep upper arm by ear
Extend arm fully overhead
Lower with control
Complete all reps before switching sides

name: Single Arm Dumbbell Overhead Extension
description: Isolation exercise targeting the triceps. Excellent for developing individual arm strength and control.
directions: Stand or sit with dumbbell held overhead
Keep upper arm by ear
Lower weight behind head
Extend arm back up
Keep upper arm stationary
Complete all reps before switching sides

name: Cable Lateral Raise
description: Isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids. Great for developing shoulder width with constant tension.
directions: Stand sideways to low cable
Grab handle with outside hand
Keep slight bend in elbow
Raise arm out to side to shoulder level
Lower with control
Complete all reps before switching sides

name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
description: Isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids. Excellent for developing shoulder balance and posture.
directions: Stand facing cable machine
Grab handles with arms crossed
Bend slightly at hips
Pull handles out to sides
Squeeze rear delts at peak
Return with control

name: Smith Machine Squat
description: Compound exercise targeting the entire lower body. Great for building leg strength with reduced stabilization requirements.
directions: Position bar on upper back
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Unrack bar and step back slightly
Lower into squat position
Drive through heels to stand
Keep chest up throughout

name: Smith Machine Calf Raise
description: A machine-based exercise that targets the calves by performing standing heel raises using the Smith machine bar for resistance and balance.
directions: Position yourself under the Smith machine bar with the balls of your feet on an elevated platform
Place the bar across your upper back/shoulders
Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart
Lower your heels toward the ground
Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible
Pause briefly at the top
Lower back down under control
cues: Push through the balls of your feet
Keep your legs straight but not locked

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
description: A machine-based variation of the bench press that targets the chest muscles using a fixed barbell path for enhanced stability and safety.
directions: Lie on the bench with your eyes under the bar
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Unrack the bar and lower it to your mid-chest
Press the bar back up to the starting position
Maintain control throughout the movement
cues: Keep your back flat on the bench
Drive your feet into the ground

name: Smith Machine Incline Bench Press
description: An upper chest-focused pressing movement performed on an incline bench using the Smith machine for added stability.
directions: Set the bench to a 30-45 degree angle
Lie on the incline bench with your eyes under the bar
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Unrack the bar and lower it to your upper chest
Press the bar back up to the starting position
cues: Keep your back against the bench
Drive your feet into the ground
Focus on the upper chest contraction

name: Smith Machine Shoulder Press
description: A vertical pressing movement using the Smith machine that primarily targets the shoulder muscles with fixed bar path for stability.
directions: Sit on the bench with your back supported
Grip the bar at shoulder width
Start with the bar at shoulder level
Press the bar overhead until arms are extended
Lower the bar back to shoulder level under control
cues: Don't lock out elbows at the top

name: Dumbbell Row
description: A back exercise performed with dumbbells that targets the latissimus dorsi and upper back muscles through a pulling motion.
directions: Hinge at your hips with a flat back
Hold dumbbells with arms fully extended
Pull the dumbbells to your hip level
Squeeze your back muscles at the top
Lower the weights with control

name: Single Arm Dumbbell Row
description: An unilateral back exercise that allows for greater range of motion and core engagement while targeting the lats and upper back.
directions: Place one knee and hand on a bench
Hold a dumbbell in your free hand
Keep your back parallel to the ground
Pull the dumbbell to your hip
Lower the weight with control
cues: Pull through your back, not your arm

name: Assisted Dip
description: A machine-assisted version of the dip exercise that helps build chest and triceps strength while providing counterbalance support.
directions: Adjust the assist weight appropriately
Grasp the parallel bars firmly
Keep your chest up and core tight
Lower your body until your upper arms are parallel to the ground
Push back up to the starting position
cues: Keep your elbows close to your body

name: Assisted Pull Up
description: A machine-assisted version of the pull-up that helps build back and arm strength while providing counterbalance support.
directions: Adjust the assist weight appropriately
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Start with arms fully extended
Pull yourself up until your chin clears the bar
Lower back down with control

name: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
description: A unilateral lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, glutes, and hip flexors while improving balance and stability.
directions: Place your back foot on a bench behind you
Hold dumbbells at your sides
Keep your front foot flat on the ground
Lower your back knee toward the ground
Push through your front foot to return to the start
cues: Keep your front knee aligned with your toes

name: Dumbbell Lunge
description: A dynamic lower body exercise that targets the legs and glutes while improving balance and coordination.
directions: Stand with dumbbells at your sides
Take a step forward with one leg
Lower your back knee toward the ground
Push off your front foot to return to start
Alternate legs with each rep
cues: Keep your front knee aligned with your toes

name: Glute Ham Raise
description: A challenging posterior chain exercise that targets the glutes and hamstrings through a controlled hip extension movement.
directions: Position yourself in the GHR machine with your ankles secured
Start with your torso upright and core engaged
Lower your torso forward while keeping your hips extended
Use your glutes and hamstrings to raise your torso back up
Maintain control throughout the movement

name: Preacher Curl
description: An isolation exercise that targets the biceps while eliminating momentum by supporting the upper arms on an angled pad.
directions: Adjust the preacher bench to your height
Rest your armpits on the top of the pad
Grasp the barbell with an underhand grip
Lower the weight with control
Curl the weight up using your biceps
cues: Keep upper arms in contact with pad

name: Reverse Grip Barbell Curl
description: A variation of the barbell curl using a pronated grip to emphasize forearm development while still targeting the biceps.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Grip the barbell with palms facing down
Keep elbows close to your sides
Curl the weight up toward your shoulders
Lower the weight with control

name: Single Arm Lat Pulldown
description: A unilateral back exercise that allows for greater range of motion and helps identify and correct muscle imbalances.
directions: Sit facing the machine with feet flat
Grasp the handle with one hand
Lean back slightly with chest up
Pull the handle down to your shoulder
Control the return to starting position

name: Dip
description: A bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the triceps and chest muscles through a pressing movement.
directions: Grip parallel bars with arms straight
Keep chest up and core engaged
Lower your body until upper arms are parallel to ground
Push yourself back up to starting position
Maintain control throughout

name: Chest Supported Dumbbell Row
description: A back exercise performed on an incline bench that provides stability and isolates the back muscles by eliminating momentum.
directions: Lie face down on an incline bench
Let arms hang straight down with dumbbells
Pull dumbbells up toward your lower chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Lower weights with control

name: Incline Chest Press
description: A machine-based pressing movement that targets the upper chest muscles with a fixed path of motion for stability.
directions: Adjust seat height appropriately
Grip handles at chest level
Press the weight forward and up
Control the return to start position
Keep back against pad throughout

name: Barbell Shoulder Press
description: A compound exercise that targets the entire shoulder complex through a vertical pressing movement.
directions: Position barbell at upper chest/shoulder level
Grip slightly wider than shoulder width
Press the bar overhead until arms are extended
Lower the bar back to shoulders with control
Maintain stable core throughout

name: Seated Dumbbell Curl
description: An isolation exercise for the biceps performed from a seated position to minimize body momentum and focus on proper form.
directions: Sit with back supported and feet flat
Hold dumbbells at your sides
Curl weights toward shoulders
Lower with control
Alternate arms or curl simultaneously

name: Spider Curl
description: A biceps isolation exercise performed lying face down on an incline bench to maximize peak contraction.
directions: Lie face down on an incline bench
Let arms hang straight down with dumbbells
Curl weights toward shoulders
Squeeze biceps at the top
Lower with control

name: Single Arm Cable Row
description: A unilateral back exercise that allows for natural movement patterns and helps identify muscle imbalances.
directions: Stand facing cable machine
Grab handle with one hand
Step back to create tension
Pull handle to your side
Control the return

name: Underhand Lat Pulldown
description: A variation of the lat pulldown using a supinated grip to increase biceps engagement while still targeting the back.
directions: Sit facing the machine with feet flat
Grip the bar with palms facing up
Lean back slightly with chest up
Pull the bar down to upper chest
Control the return to start

name: V-Bar Lat Pulldown
description: A lat pulldown variation using a V-bar attachment that allows for a neutral grip position and natural movement pattern.
directions: Sit facing machine with feet flat
Grasp V-bar with neutral grip
Lean back slightly with chest up
Pull bar down toward upper chest
Control return to start position

name: Wide Grip Cable Row
description: A back exercise that emphasizes the upper back muscles through a wide grip position on the cable machine.
directions: Sit at cable row machine
Grasp wide bar with overhand grip
Keep chest up and core tight
Pull handle to lower chest
Control return to start

name: Sumo Deadlift
description: A compound exercise variation that emphasizes the inner thighs and glutes through a wider stance position.
directions: Stand with wide stance, toes pointed out
Grip bar inside legs
Keep chest up and back flat
Drive through heels to stand
Return bar to ground with control

name: Dumbbell Upright Row
description: A shoulder exercise that targets the lateral deltoids and upper traps through a vertical pulling motion.
directions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold dumbbells in front of thighs
Pull dumbbells straight up toward chin
Keep elbows higher than forearms
Lower weights with control

name: Cable Upright Row
description: A shoulder exercise using cables that provides constant tension throughout the movement while targeting the lateral deltoids and traps.
directions: Stand facing cable machine
Grasp straight bar attachment
Pull bar straight up toward chin
Keep elbows higher than forearms
Lower with control

name: Back Extension
description: An isolation exercise that targets the lower back muscles and helps develop core stability and spinal erector strength.
directions: Position yourself in the back extension machine
Cross arms over chest or behind head
Lower your torso toward the ground
Raise your torso until body forms a straight line
Lower back down with control

name: Dumbbell Chest Press
description: A compound chest exercise that allows for natural movement patterns and helps develop balanced strength.
directions: Lie on bench with feet flat on floor
Hold dumbbells at chest level
Press weights straight up
Lower weights with control
Keep wrists straight throughout

name: Incline Dumbbell Tricep Extension
description: An isolation exercise that targets the triceps while providing a greater range of motion through an incline position.
directions: Lie on an incline bench
Hold dumbbells overhead with arms straight
Lower weights behind head
Extend arms back to start
Keep upper arms stationary

name: Dumbbell Side Curl
description: A biceps variation that emphasizes the outer head of the biceps through a unique curling angle.
directions: Stand with dumbbells at sides
Keep arms slightly away from body
Curl weights up and slightly outward
Squeeze biceps at the top
Lower with control

name: Split Squat
description: A unilateral leg exercise that develops balance, stability, and strength in the lower body.
directions: Take a long step forward
Keep torso upright
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front foot to rise
Maintain split stance throughout set

name: Rope Overhead Extension
description: A triceps isolation exercise using a rope attachment that allows for a natural range of motion and peak contraction.
directions: Face away from cable machine
Hold rope overhead with elbows pointing up
Keep upper arms still
Extend arms to straighten elbows
Control return to start

name: Cable Rope Curls
description: A biceps exercise using a rope attachment that allows for a natural supinating motion during the curl.
directions: Stand facing cable machine
Grasp rope with palms facing each other
Keep elbows at sides
Curl rope toward shoulders
Lower with control

name: Hanging Leg Raises
description: An advanced core exercise that targets the entire abdominal region while improving grip strength and stability.
directions: Hang from pull-up bar with straight arms
Keep legs straight
Raise legs until parallel to ground
Lower legs with control
Minimize swinging

name: Hanging Knee Raise
description: A core exercise that targets the lower abs while being more accessible than straight leg raises.
directions: Hang from pull-up bar with straight arms
Keep core engaged
Raise knees toward chest
Lower with control
Minimize swinging

name: Candlestick
description: A dynamic core exercise that targets the entire abdominal region through a rolling motion.
directions: Lie on back with legs straight up
Roll hips off ground
Point toes toward ceiling
Lower legs over head
Return to start with control

name: Line Leg Raise
description: A core exercise performed on the ground that targets the lower abs through a controlled leg raise movement.
directions: Lie on back with legs straight
Press lower back into ground
Raise legs to 90 degrees
Lower legs with control
Keep legs straight throughout

name: Russian Twist
description: A rotational core exercise that targets the obliques and helps develop rotational strength and stability.
directions: Sit with knees bent and feet off ground
Lean back slightly
Hold weight at chest level
Rotate torso side to side
Touch weight to ground on each side

name: Crunch
description: A basic abdominal exercise that targets the upper abs through spinal flexion.
directions: Lie on back with knees bent
Place hands behind head
Lift shoulder blades off ground
Squeeze abs at top
Lower with control

name: Cable Hip Abduction
description: An isolation exercise targeting the outer hip muscles to improve hip stability and strength.
directions: Stand sideways to cable machine
Attach ankle cuff to outside leg
Keep standing leg slightly bent
Lift working leg out to side
Control return to start

name: Cable Hip Adduction
description: An isolation exercise targeting the inner thigh muscles to improve hip stability and strength.
directions: Stand sideways to cable machine
Attach ankle cuff to inside leg
Keep standing leg slightly bent
Pull working leg across body
Control return to start

name: Machine Bicep Curl
description: An isolation exercise using a machine that provides consistent resistance throughout the bicep curl movement.
directions: Adjust seat height appropriately
Grasp handles with palms up
Keep elbows on pad
Curl weight up
Lower with control

name: Bodyweight Row
description: A compound back exercise using your own body weight that helps develop upper body pulling strength.
directions: Position yourself under a bar
Grip bar with hands wider than shoulders
Keep body straight
Pull chest to bar
Lower with control

name: Cable Wrist Curls
description: An isolation exercise targeting the forearm flexors using a cable machine for consistent tension.
directions: Stand facing cable machine
Grasp handle with palm up
Keep forearm supported and still
Curl wrist upward
Lower with control

name: Cable Reverse Wrist Curls
description: An isolation exercise targeting the forearm extensors using a cable machine for consistent tension throughout the movement.
directions: Stand facing cable machine
Grasp handle with palm down
Keep forearm supported and still
Extend wrist upward
Lower with control

name: Cable Crunch
description: A core exercise using cable resistance to target the abdominals through a controlled crunching motion.
directions: Kneel facing away from cable machine
Hold rope attachment behind head
Keep hips stationary
Crunch down toward floor
Control return to start

name: Cable Bar Raise
description: A shoulder isolation exercise using a cable machine to target the lateral deltoids through a controlled raising motion.
directions: Stand sideways to cable machine
Grasp bar with outside hand
Keep slight bend in elbow
Raise arm out to side
Lower with control

name: Single Arm Cable Pushdown
description: An isolation exercise targeting the triceps using one arm at a time for improved focus and mind-muscle connection.
directions: Stand facing cable machine
Grasp handle with one hand
Keep upper arm at side
Extend arm down fully
Control return to start

name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
description: An isolation exercise targeting the forearm flexors using dumbbells for balanced strength development.
directions: Sit with forearms on thighs
Hold dumbbells with palms up
Let wrists extend fully
Curl weights up with wrists
Lower with control

name: Reverse Dumbbell Wrist Curl
description: An isolation exercise targeting the forearm extensors using dumbbells with a pronated grip.
directions: Sit with forearms on thighs
Hold dumbbells with palms down
Let wrists flex fully
Extend wrists upward
Lower with control

name: Goblet Squat
description: A compound lower body exercise holding a dumbbell or kettlebell at chest height, great for developing squat form and core strength.
directions: Hold weight at chest height
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Keep chest up
Squat down keeping weight centered
Drive through heels to stand

name: Lunge
description: A fundamental lower body exercise that develops unilateral strength, balance, and coordination.
directions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Step forward with one leg
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front foot to return
Alternate legs each rep

name: Dumbbell Step Ups
description: A unilateral leg exercise that builds strength and stability while improving hip mobility and balance.
directions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Stand facing step or platform
Step up with one foot
Drive through heel to stand
Step back down with control

name: Dumbbell Upright Row
description: A shoulder exercise that targets the deltoids and upper traps through a vertical pulling motion.
directions: Stand with dumbbells in front
Pull weights up toward chin
Keep elbows above forearms
Lower with control
Maintain upright posture

name: Shrugs
description: An isolation exercise targeting the upper trapezius muscles through an upward shoulder shrugging motion.
directions: Stand holding weights at sides
Keep arms straight
Elevate shoulders straight up
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control

name: Meadows Row
description: A unilateral back exercise using a landmine or barbell that provides a unique angle for targeting the lats and upper back.
directions: Stand parallel to barbell
Hinge at hips
Grasp end of barbell
Pull weight to hip
Lower with control

name: Single Arm Preacher Curl
description: An isolation exercise targeting one bicep at a time using the preacher bench for strict form.
directions: Adjust preacher bench height
Rest arm on pad
Hold dumbbell with full extension
Curl weight up
Lower with control

name: Muscle Up
description: An advanced calisthenics movement combining a powerful pull-up with a transition to a dip position.
directions: Hang from pull-up bar
Pull explosively upward
Drive hips to bar
Transition over bar
Press to full extension

name: Torso Rotation
description: A core exercise that targets the obliques and rotational strength using cable resistance.
directions: Stand sideways to cable machine
Grasp handle at chest height
Keep arms extended
Rotate away from machine
Control return to start

name: Treadmill
description: Cardiovascular exercise that involves walking or running on a moving belt. Great for building endurance and burning calories.
directions: Step onto the treadmill and clip the safety key to your clothing
Start at a comfortable walking pace
Gradually increase speed to desired level
Maintain good posture throughout
Use the handles only when necessary
cues: Stay in the center of the belt

name: Bike
description: Low-impact cardiovascular exercise that targets the lower body. Great for building endurance while being gentle on the joints.
directions: Adjust the seat height so your leg is slightly bent at the bottom of the pedal stroke
Start pedaling at a comfortable pace
Maintain good posture throughout
Adjust resistance as needed
cues: Keep your feet flat on the pedals

name: Elliptical
description: Low-impact cardio exercise that targets the full body. Great for building cardiovascular endurance.
directions: Step onto the elliptical and grab the handles
Start pedaling in a smooth, controlled motion
Keep your core engaged and maintain good posture
Push and pull the handles in coordination with your leg movements

name: Reverse Crunch
description: Isolation exercise targeting the lower abs. Good for building core strength and definition.
directions: Lie on your back with your legs raised and knees bent at 90 degrees
Place your arms flat on the ground by your sides
Using your lower abs, lift your hips off the ground and bring your knees toward your chest
Lower back down with control
Repeat for desired reps
cues: Focus on using your lower abs to initiate the movement
Keep your lower back pressed against the ground

name: Plank
description: Isometric exercise that targets the core. Excellent for building core stability and endurance.
directions: Get into a push-up position with your forearms on the ground
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Hold this position while maintaining proper form
Hold for desired duration
